server.response
Class MoveResponse

java.lang.Object
  server.response.MoveResponse
All Implemented Interfaces:
ServerResponse
public class MoveResponse
extends java.lang.Object
implements ServerResponse

Responds to the move command as input by the user. Specifically, this will move a user from his current room, to the room which is connected by an exit the user selects.

Constructor Summary
MoveResponse()
          Default constructor.
MoveResponse(Direction direction)
          Alternative constructor for MoveResponse that takes a direction.
 
Method Summary
 ClientMessage respond(ServerThread serverThread, Direction direction)
          An alternative respond method that takes a direction instead of a list of arguments.
 ClientMessage respond(ServerThread serverThread, java.util.List<java.lang.String> arguments)
          Move the player (and notify users in both the old and new room) if possible.

respond

public ClientMessage respond(ServerThread serverThread,
                             java.util.List<java.lang.String> arguments)
Move the player (and notify users in both the old and new room) if possible.

Specified by:
respond in interface ServerResponse
Parameters:
serverThread - ServerThread requesting this response
arguments - arguments passed from the client as part of the command, which can be used to determine an appropriate response
Returns:
response to be sent back to the client

respond

public ClientMessage respond(ServerThread serverThread,
                             Direction direction)
An alternative respond method that takes a direction instead of a list of arguments. This may be used directly by other responses such as NorthResponse, EastResponse etc.
